content:
hey Harry!

Yeah, I use Vonage for my business line at home as it was MUCH cheaper then installing my own land line, or having an additional phone drop added to my office (yes, my builder didn't put a phone line in my office. GRR).

So far Vonage has been awesome! I pay $15/month for 500 minutes (I never use that much, personally). And, have all the great features (more then what I get on my land line and pay an arm and a leg for).

It's good to see AT&T pushing their VOIP. Traditional phone companies should be scared. This technology is awesome, and a low price point. 


Take care!
-Jason

Harry,

I concur, I now have 3 vonage lines, $15 each, and leave 1/2 of that 500 minutes on the table at the end of the month. Customer support has been great. I have only used the online, But Mildred in NY has called and gotten personal assistance, and even got my 'spif' for the referal to her fixed while on line. A++ for Vonage, I hope the others keep pace, and make/keep it competitive.

Tom

Vonage is great - had it for a month or so now.  I do get an AC hum on the line at times despite having switched TAs, but I think its actually an issue with the cordless phone.

If you want to sign up, I'll be happy to catch the referral!  I also agree the customer support has been great...

Chris
